title: How to study maths for the IIT JEE from class 11 (2022 aspiring) - Quora

response.answer_text: The foundation for Maths… There's actually nothing of topics or anything as foundation though, but actually instead it is how your brain is trained to the problems… that's built in your classes 1-10. Now in my case our math class 1-5 (a simple hindi medium school of Haryana board) at that time was like very high level from classes and in fact the things which I studied the things I knew in class 2 again in class 6 or 7 (CBSE)… difference… The thing is… mind was well shaped… Simply test your mind… take some very seeming construction problem or geometry or trigonometry… how you can solve in just in your mind will give an idea… take a very complex function in x say which is not solvable without calculator (like y=xe^x - very simple) and try to mould very much to find x without calc if fn value is given. You'll know your level and that'd give a start… My interest in maths attracted me to the trickiest functions and trigonometry and dimensions and calculus problems… Started with RD Sharma Objective maths in class 11th summer vacations and finished each question upto chapter 7… that much was more than enough for me to start visualizing problems… When you start seeing things, things become easy… and i could see functions and solutions forming in my mind… after that I was with my school textbooks and later on JEE Advanced problems and few JEE magazines only I think that much would be enough as you can understand the rest… (In my whole 2 years, I attended classes (more than 100% attendance can say) I didn't have phone and TV.. in fact school library, books, and above all my mind to solve my problems… (had great teachers but never bothered them much for this)… and daily I had averaged 6 hours to study, and for weeks I'd study one subject and then other and like that… no tensions of keeping up with school nor coaching… all that was an important factor for my mind that's why I mentioned…) “Mathematics is decoding the shapes by shaping your minds" -always applies. Best of Luck Regards ~Himanshu
